text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that assigning responsibilities to the tenant does not remove the owner\u2019s responsibility for common or shared areas. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under the 'Shared Space Management' section, stating: 'Courts hold building owners to high standard' and '\"Shared\" doesn't mean \"shared liability\"\u2014you retain ultimate responsibility.' Furthermore, in the conclusion, it states: 'The fact that another company caused the direct cause (untested equipment) does NOT absolve you of responsibility. As building owner, you had a duty to ensure all equipment in your premises was safe, regardless of who owned it.' This directly satisfies the requirement.", "criterion_id": "61540037-65b5-4926-9628-43ec17bf3eec"}
